text: Peter Alexander Hoy (born June 29, 1966) is a former relief pitcher in Major League Baseball who played briefly for the Boston Red Sox during the 1992 season. Listed at , , Hoy batted and threw right-handed. A native of Brockville, Ontario, Hoy attended LeMoyne College, and in 1987 he played collegiate summer baseball with the Chatham A's of the Cape Cod Baseball League. He was selected by Boston in the 33rd round of the 1988 MLB Draft. In five relief appearances, Hoy posted a 7.36 ERA with two strikeouts and two walks in 3⅔ innings of work.
